text:
In the vision that we
have of change,

we opt for disruption,
so looking through another prism

and thinking differently, hence
this allows us to consider

future systems
and not simply -

updating
an old system

with old
methodologies,

as much in development
as in construction
and infrastructure.

My name is Benito Diz,
CIO
of Veolia Eau France.

Veolia Eau France is a water
supply, and waste

water filtration and
reclamation company

for municipalities
and industry.

It's a company with
3 billion in turnover,

and 8 million B2B2C
customers.

Veolia Eau France, the former
Compagnie Générale des Eaux,
is a 160-year-old company.

For the cloud, we sought
private cloud

solutions provided
by certain providers,

with highly structured, rigid
implementation

and launch methods,
and we opted

for AWS, because
it was flexible enough

and that allowed us
to build our virtual data centers

and our systems
as we wished,

without constraints, that's
why we chose AWS.

The fact that the French
market over time has changed,

that customer requests
on new reportings,

new needs
are increasingly urgent,

AWS-type solutions
enable putting into place

solutions more
nimbly and rapidly,

which was not the case with
traditional solutions.

We have made the choice
of trying out

AWS technologies,
with the decision to make

a real virtual data center
infrastructure.

So before migrating
any application,

or installing
any application,

because it's as much
about migration as direct

launch on AWS, we have
built an entirely virtual

organized data center
structure with development,

training, re-reset,
preproduction,

and production environments,
and all these environments

have been state-of-the-art
set in place both on the

data center structural level
as the security one.

The principal is to create
virtual data centers

to migrate everything into
the cloud and separate us

from CAPEX, and hence
physical infrastructure.

The application we have
is called New Management.
Except that it from the 1970s,

and we are in the process
of re-platforming it

very simply
to reduce the cost,

to divide the
run costs by ten.

It manages all customer
relations and all invoicing
for 8 million customers.

So the re-platforming effect
allows us to offer

new services around,
and pile on digital layers

on, a system where it was historically
impossible
to change it.

While Veolia Eau France
has a CIO

who is quite young,
who just has a few weeks

to avoid confusing
pronouncements

between business
and information,

we have also created
the business of AWS.

Today on our customer management
and invoicing

applications, we are
in shared environments,

huge CICS and MVS systems
with CPU
time-sharing.

This system needs
to increase processor

capacity for every
invoicing cycle.

Globally, this system
today costs us

€1.5 million annually for Veolia
Eau France services,

and regarding AWS calculation
rules has been
estimated at €150,000 annually,

on a transactional
infrastructure which was

identically reproduced
with modern tools on AWS.
